content: Reverting to 115 may be an option, if that profile is still intact. Another possibility would be to exit TB and copy the backed-up abook.sqlite into the profile. 102 is dead for future updates, and once in 115, I suggest staying
creator: davidsk

content:
After the upgrade to Supernova, You can not use it for previous Versions. However, You made a backup! - Stop TB - De-install it - replace Your upgraded profile by Your backup copy - -re-install TB 102

worked for me.

HTH, Thomas
creator: thomas.eifert

content: Addons are plentiful in 115. Just use the search window in tools>addons. The Thunderhtml addon was moved by author to https://www.betterbird.eu/addons/ and it works well in 115. I would not consider going back to 102, as that is a deadend for any future upgrades.
creator: davidsk

content:
I believe this is just an HTML issue, not a Thunderbird issue. Just add this to the body tag: 

    <body style="background-color: your-color-choice;">
creator: davidsk

content:
Okay, a techy friend appeared and has accepted the exception based on a soon-to-be transfer of my email from my ISP to another company, The Messaging Company, which I have agreed to previously. Though there is no word this has started ...

For any other Aussies with iiNet moving to The Messaging Company, using Thunderbird, may be useful.
creator: becbecbec

content: Try removing the account then add it afresh. If your messages are not left on the server, then DO NOT delete message data when removing the account.
creator: stancestans

content: I suggest you contact the Mailmerge author, as he/she will likely want to fix any problems, since that is a popular addon.
creator: davidsk

content: I am not sure, but this sounds like a problem with your device logging into the server mail account to download. Have you changed or updated anything recently? If not, (or even if so!) can you check the configuration of you email downloads is still correct? If you can download emails to phone, are there any that are too big or 'not ordinary' > and if you do not need them, delete them using the phone? You may need to contact the server ISP and check that the configurations are correct, unless you still have their set-up instructions. Best of luck, David
creator: d.church

content: You didn't tell us much, except that your password works online. Several email providers now require unique passwords when their services are accessed from email clients. If yours is one of those, you may need a special password when accessing from the new PC. An example is Gmail. Tell us more about your account and someone here may have more information.
creator: davidsk

content:
If you click the Unread button on the Quick Filter Bar, and also click the pin icon at the left end of the bar, the filter is retained when opening other folders.

To show Original html, use v. 9 of this add-on.

Filter on Folder Button
creator: sfhowes

content:
This is done by Gmail. You do NOT need them, as they are a duplicate of every message. I suggest this: - highlight account on main pane - rightclick and select 'subscribe' - untick the allmail folder

(In case you also see the 'important' folder, that is another one that Gmail administers. It also can be UNticked)

DO NOT attempt to delete these folders.

As a sidenote, you can also go to gmail online account and define which folders should not be accessible to an email client.
creator: davidsk
